subject: RE: [junit] Control test order in base test case hierarchy.
msgSnippet: ... Suite.addTest(SuperClass.suite()) seems to dtrt, but it seems that you *must* roll up up your tests in the subclass i.e. in the supbclass, you must:
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ray Tayek [mailto:rtayek@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 25, 2004 7:18 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Control test order in base test case hierarchy.
>
> ... It seems as soon as I use
> suite() to control the order, junit does not find the tests
> in the super-classes of that test case. ...
>
> Having each suite do an addTest(SuperClass.suite()) seems to
> fix the problem.
>

Suite.addTest(SuperClass.suite()) seems to dtrt, but it seems that you
*must* roll up up your tests in the subclass i.e. in the supbclass, you
must: suite.addTest(SubClassTestCase("nameOfTestInSuperClass"));

thanks
